text: ‘That’s not my job’: Miami police chief rejects proposed anti-sanctuary city policy

text: Congrats! A wonderful honor.

text: Why was @RonDeSantisFl and Florida legislators so eager to move a bill that overturns the policy of @ScottforFlorida on medical marijuana? Follow the money by @NewsbySmiley

text: When we laid out the elements of the ⁦@joenegronfl⁩ = GeoGroup deal in August 2016 and got a denial from spox Sarah Bascom,  hindsight now suggests there was nothing plausible about the lawyer’s deniability.
author: MaryEllenKlas

text: Is @RonDeSantisFL carefully teeing up important challenges the right wants before SCOTUS? What would happen if these laws pass and the left doesn’t challenge them, or drags out a legal challenge?
author: MaryEllenKlas

text: He also defended his underwriting of the lawsuit that killed Gawker. 'Our constitution doesn't just have a 1st Amendment. It has a 4th amendment' which he argues the Tampa jury ruled had been violated with the publishing of Hulk Hogan's sex tape.
author: MaryEllenKlas

text: .@peterthiel elaborates: 'universities are as corrupt today as the Catholic Church was on the eve of the Protestant Reformation...tuitions that are like indulgences, a salvation story that if you get a degree from Harvard, you end up in a good place' he wants new 'Reformation'
author: MaryEllenKlas

text: Speaking to @CornelWest and Roberto Unger's #HarvardLaw class, PayPal fdr @peterthiel says 'propaganda' from elite colleges is they contribute to the knowledge economy but 'the real self-understanding is this is a Studio 54 night club and we have a massive velvet rope to get in'
author: MaryEllenKlas

text: Here's why this idea is dangerous: Because Texas records were not sealed, reporters @davidmcswane and @adchavez were able to reveal how a Medicaid provider refused care to many, incl. a foster baby, who is now in a persistent vegetative state. Last night they won #GoldsmithAward.
author: MaryEllenKlas

text: Marty Baron of @washingtonpost says he would have ‘needed a higher standard’ - such as new info - before he would have printed the anonymous op-Ed that ran in @nytimes criticizing Trump admin. ‘What was new was that it was written’ and that wasn’t high enough.
author: MaryEllenKlas

text: Why Miami won’t be hosting the 2020 Democratic convention (and Milwaukee will)
author: MaryEllenKlas

text: What do @realdonaldtrump and Robert Kraft have in common? Vanity photos with the owner of the Asian Day Spa -- who wanted to show off her excellent access -- and perhaps more. via @Blaskey_S @NickNehamas @ceostroff @miamiherald
author: MaryEllenKlas

text: Question for @FLGOPMajority and @FLSenate: Are you relying on the most recent data to inform your education, housing and econ dev policies? If so, you've seen the http://OpportunityAtlas.org  and this telling data from http://OpportunityInsights.org . Beware Florida's #downwardmobility zones.
author: MaryEllenKlas

text: Imagine a Facebook where content is encrypted and eventually disappears. Who controls? https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2019/03/06/facebooks-mark-zuckerberg-says-hell-reorient-company-towards-encryption-privacy/?utm_term=.c2344d54837a … #mppdigital
author: MaryEllenKlas

text: 1. List the agenda and $ of the big donors this session 2. List what bills are moving, and 3. List what big public policy issues aren't moving. At the end of  session, the real story is often what's in negative relief. Here @GrayRohrer sets the stage:
author: MaryEllenKlas

text: This is the first FL Legislative session I won't be covering in two decades but, friends, I'll be watching from afar with interest! @GrayRohrer's good piece today on the agenda of the monied interests reminds me how I used to decide what to cover: create three lists (1/2)
author: MaryEllenKlas

text: Jeff Flake likes electoral college ‘because it emphasizes federalists’ but there are ‘two few congressional seats that are competitive,’ and that is a product of legislative gerrymandering @harvardiop
author: MaryEllenKlas

text: Jeff Flake: protectionist and anti-immigrant policies “are not conservative” but the minute you move to the middle “you are hit by both sides” including “death threats” from right and left. @harvardiop
author: MaryEllenKlas

text: Former Arizona Sen. Jeff Flake says ‘commuter Congress’ is one of contributors to partisan trend @harvardiop #JFKForumLive
author: MaryEllenKlas

text: Hey guys - Unsolicited request. Readers need to know this. Ask them pointed questions - not open requests for comment -- include the question in the story and the fact that their elected leaders don't want the public to know what their position is on this. #transparencyforall
author: MaryEllenKlas

text: This is a must watch from @knightfdn : danah boyd, founder of Data and Society, explains the exploitation of social media data voids and - YES - how local journalism, and its role in binding communities, is a solution to the dangers of fragmented truth:
author: MaryEllenKlas

text: There is nothing surprising here if you look at behavior patterns and voting research. There has been a lot of misplaced optimism on the left that decades of vote suppression will result in the kind of change in behavior needed to turn elections in Florida. More researched needed
author: MaryEllenKlas

text: Thanks, Jim, but unfortunately I haven't taken a buyout. Just opened the door for the option, as many others in the chain have done. Pure pragmatics.
author: MaryEllenKlas

text: Clarification @MarcCaputo. I'm on leave on a fellowship trying to explore the impact of the loss of local journalism. I can't leave reporting. I'm not in the same category as the others and the window for a decision has not closed. I'm doing what's wise, keeping options open.
author: MaryEllenKlas

text: So what do you think? Will Facebook agree to the idea of being 'information fiduciaries' if they don't get to define the terms? #mppdigital

text: That's at the end of a very long and detailed story -- which details why he's concerned the nation - forget about which party - is allowing itself to be subject to manipulation and menace. Guess you missed that. Hope your eyes recover.

text: Did you read the story? Doubting it, if this is your reflection on it.
author: MaryEllenKlas

text: This “hypertargeting” of ads is “negative for our democracy,” Stamos says. “Imagine you could afford to send a mailer to every single voter in the country and every single one of them is different. You’re not two-faced; you’re one-hundred-million-faced."
author: MaryEllenKlas

text: Fascinating conclusion by Big Tech's security guru Alex Stamos about 2016: “The Trump campaign and the Republican PACs were so much better at Facebook ads than the Democratic side...well over 100 times more dollars spent than the Russians...” #DPI321
author: MaryEllenKlas

text: Fascinating profile of Big Tech security expert Alex Stamos who believes “The mass media was completely played" by the Russians in 2016 elections, and "there has been almost no self-reflection by NYT/WaPo/WSJ/TV on their role.” #MPPDigital https://finance.yahoo.com/news/facebook-security-officer-alex-stamos-targeting-risk-142859539.html …
author: MaryEllenKlas

text: .@nytimes analyzes six years of @actblue fundraising data to find Dem horserace winners to date. Notable: small donor infrastructure is now central to Dems strategy, but is there anyone besides Trump working this on the right? #DPI321
author: MaryEllenKlas

text: Friends in local journalism. Please consider applying for this fellowship. Deadline is a week away, but it's easy. We need you - and the experience will be the best of a lifetime!
author: MaryEllenKlas

text: Donations pour in after low Hurricane Michael support reported | Miami Herald ⁦@mahoneysthename⁩ making a difference!
author: MaryEllenKlas

text: There the @nytimes - and @washingtonpost - and everyone else. "Last year the company added 120 newsroom employees, bringing the total number of journalists at The Times to 1,600, the largest count in its history." Wow:
author: MaryEllenKlas

text: Tech moves that nobody noticed according to @ghoshd7 @JFKJrForum : Apple will allow Chinese govt access to data flowing over its network in China; Cambridge Analytica likely had access to 87 m Facebook user IDs; FB amalgamating WhatsApp, Instagram and text messages #mppditigal
author: MaryEllenKlas

text: Glorious news great girl!
author: MaryEllenKlas

text: Does this mean Gannett is not ready to be devoured for its parts? #eraofvulturecapital #mppdigital
author: MaryEllenKlas

text: "If we value accountable democracy, that is. Subscriptions are a good place to start, yes, but look for opportunities to support things like foundation journalism (what ProPublica is doing, for example)..." and (my suggestion) @report4america.
author: MaryEllenKlas

text: "We are on the cusp of a country full of news deserts, medium and small communities with no newspaper to watch those in power."
author: MaryEllenKlas

text: Why do newspaper layoffs keep happening? Publisher/shareholder greed. Distribution disruption. Death spiral. Future is best for those without 'debt service millstone' who innovate, (sorry @McClatchy). A smart explainer by @JeremyLittau #mppdigital
author: MaryEllenKlas

text: I'm saddened by the announcement of buyouts at @mcclatchy and @MiamiHerald today. What will it mean when we decrease coverage of local government? More polarization of politics. This reports explains: (#mppdigital)
author: MaryEllenKlas

text: (Note, @MiamiHerald was not included in this survey.)
author: MaryEllenKlas

text: We don't have gender parity when it comes to the nation's biggest newsrooms. Anyone surprised? #mppdigital
author: MaryEllenKlas

text: True, and actually he is not first to describe it this way...
author: MaryEllenKlas

text: So after you read @scavendish. Keep this conversation going -- and ask your Congress person: is the First Amendment still relevant and, if so, what are you doing to help protect your community from losing its news watchdogs.
author: MaryEllenKlas

text: But the nature of journalism is to engage -- in exposing of truth, telling important stories, synthesizing information, hounding public officials. It's such an essential component to our democracy that the First Amendment assumes there will be effective watchdog news media.
author: MaryEllenKlas

text: If any other industry were in this kind of distress, wouldn't there be an organization forming to use political pressure to help stop the carnage? A modern Fairness Doctrine? Updated anti-trust statutes? Tax consequences for hedge funds? But journalists can't engage, right?
author: MaryEllenKlas

text: Must read, on the decline in local journalism: 'The butchers are sharpening their knives.'...'We’ve learned by now that leaving local news in the hands of shareholders will only get us less.' #mppdigital
author: MaryEllenKlas

text: Wow. This is Florida's most prominent RNC leader, holding out for a Trump replacement candidate.
author: MaryEllenKlas

text: This: 'On multiple occasions...STONE told Person 2 [he] should do a “Frank Pentangeli”.. to avoid contradicting STONE’s testimony." Pentangeli is a character in the film The Godfather: Part II who testifies, and "claims not to know critical information that he does in fact know."
author: MaryEllenKlas

text: By April 2018, Stone was pretty unhappy that 'Person 2' in the indictment, planned to talk to FBI, so he sent this text: “You are a rat. A stoolie. You backstab your friends-run your mouth my lawyers are dying Rip you to shreds.” Then threatened to: “take that dog away from you,”
author: MaryEllenKlas

text: From the indictment, Stone sent this text to person expecting special counsel subpoena: “‘Stonewall it. Plead the fifth. Anything to save the plan’ . . . Richard Nixon.”
author: MaryEllenKlas

text: Trump aide Roger Stone was indicted in Fort Lauderdale today. Here's a look at his colorful and sketchy political history via @HowardCohen
author: MaryEllenKlas

text: This former Miami Hurricanes football player Demetrius Jackson says he has seen few improvements in his community since he was in high school seven years ago. His answer: he will run for state office in 2020.
author: MaryEllenKlas
